repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

body: This option was introduced to help with transitioning to the new behavior during the 0.11 release cycle with the intention of removing in 0.12.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  0.11 to aid in transitioning to the new behavior, has been removed.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -81,7 +81,8 @@ PLUGINS
 
 TREESITTER
 
-• todo
+• The "all" option to |Query:iter_matches()|, which was introduced in Nvim
+  0.11 to aide in transitioning to the new behavior, has been removed.

comment_data.body: Unrelated question but why wasn't this correctly formatted in the docs and [website](https://neovim.io/doc/user/treesitter.html#Query%3Aiter_matches())? Is it because there should be 2 spaces before the `- all`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1064,9 +1033,6 @@ end
 ---   - max_start_depth (integer) if non-zero, sets the maximum start depth
 ---     for each match. This is used to prevent traversing too deep into a tree.
 ---   - match_limit (integer) Set the maximum number of in-progress matches (Default: 256).
---- - all (boolean) When `false` (default `true`), the returned table maps capture IDs to a single

@@ -81,7 +81,8 @@ PLUGINS
 
 TREESITTER

+• The "all" option to |Query:iter_matches()|, which was introduced in Nvim
+  0.11 to aide in transitioning to the new behavior, has been removed.

comment_data.body: Yes that's right, and this was fixed in another PR since I first opened this one.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

---- - all (boolean) When `false` (default `true`), the returned table maps capture IDs to a single

comment_regular_data.body:
Note to self: This will break nvim-treesitter on nightly (and hence CI).

(I had hoped to have a bit more time for migrating to the post-0.11 world...)
We can wait to merge as long as you need.

First patch release is usually a good point to assume most people will have updated. I might also just shove in a quick&dirty "reverse compatibility" shim (extracted from the removed code) for nightly users. (I don't think it's a particularly hot path -- albeit one I'm hoping to get rid of and am loath to touch again...)
@gpanders @clason are we ready to move forward with this or need more time ?

> (This will still break the -- deprecated -- legacy `master` branch of nvim-treesitter, but I guess affected people can just switch to IceVim now...)

If you're going to break the legacy master branch, you should update the warning there. It suggests that the master branch will continue to work even if it's not the default.

> The master branch is frozen and provided for backward compatibility only. All future updates happen on the [main branch](https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/blob/main/README.md), which will become the default branch in the future.
Backward compatibility means compatibility with _old_ Neovim versions. The branch being frozen implies that _future_ incompatibilities will not be fixed. But this is off-topic here.
I've resolved the conflicts and rebased on master. @clason I defer to you, merge whenever you like.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(treesitter)!: remove "all" option of Query:iter_matches
